dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is in nice lingerie, happily getting ready for the day. She puts a lot of effort into her appearance. Products everywhere, too many hair-flips, eye-cream, no hair out of place. She walks into the bedroom, where TED, a gorgeous man sleeps. She sneaks back into the bed, carefully positioning herself and moving the sheets to show her good parts. She coughs and nudges Ted to wake him up then pretend sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. Annie pretends to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. I don't. Oh my God its the morning. I look terrible. I just woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night was fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had the best time. I have't had that much fun on a first date in years, ever... She brushes the hair off his forehead as if he were her long time lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So listen Annie, I like you. So, I want to be up front with you. I'm not really looking for a relationship right now. Annie's eyes grow large. She uncomfortably smiles at him, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooo. Oops. I mean, yeah. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to be honest right off the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Ok. Yeah. Yeah. I love that. Annie struggles to maintain her composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just so busy and I don't have time for another person...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too, I'm soo busy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And summer's coming--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, summer, exactly. It's a crazy season. So you just wanna give me a call in the fall or--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm not gonna be in town much even in the fall--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be! Yeah, Halloween--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be travelling a lot for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, I'm just- so many business trips to places that are just far awayâcause I'm doing really well at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And honestly, (sits up) I don't even know how I feel about the whole monogamy thing, is one person really enough for anyone? I mean, I like to be with a lot of different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is sooo refreshing to hear you say that, because isn't that what everyone thinks but is afraid to say? I mean, i's science. I'm-I don't want a relationship either. Let's just say that. And I wouldn't even care whatever you do or I do, I just wanna have tons of fun, like no strings attached at all. I'm just different from other girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well anyway, I really should get going. I was gonna get a haircut today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they say that every couple months it's good to trim the ends, you know, get all the dead stuff. So, cool. Cool. 've cut hair before. He waits, but Annie doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like I said I got stuff to do. Annie notices a picture of a sailboat above the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. Gonna try to get some sailing in before the weather gets crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool, well I don't wanna be Get up the jib.. late. Ted gets up. Awkward moment leading into... EXT. HOUSE. FRONT DOOR. MOMENTS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and thanks for the lemon bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no problem. Made from scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie stands at the closed driveway gate waiting as Ted repeatedly presses the button. She smiles at a neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes it sticks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I love it! The gate starts to open. Annie exits.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Byyyyee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie sits in her old shitty car. She lets out an exasperated sigh, then sees the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. The brakes squeak as she very slowly drives away. INT. ANNIE'S CAR IN TRAFFIC. CONTINUOUS. Annie gets out her phone and speed dials LILLIAN. INT. LILLIAN'S BEDROOM. Lillian is getting dressed. Upscale, professional clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's summer?! What the hell does that mean? He can't date anyone in the summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess? I don't know. I feel so stupid now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he's stupid Ann, not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I might be a little bit stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew. Did you have sex with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! But I gave him a blow job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he kept putting it in my face. Lillian's boyfriend DOUGIE enters the bedroom eating a Luna Bar in his sweats. He's stretching and flexing his muscles trying to make her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least he was honest with you so you don't waste your time with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, look how hard I worked out. Look at all this sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see that I'm on the phone? I'm talking to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you eating my Luna Bar? Those are for women you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Really?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna do anything to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. My breasts are getting bigger. He tries to rub up against Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, go take a shower. Dougie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna play with my new boobs in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I cannot handle him right now. He has been driving me crazy. Sometimes it feels like I'm kissing my brother. I don't know what do. Annie pulls into an alleyway behind HARRINGTO'S JEWELRY STORE and starts changing into her work uniform in the car. A white blouse and navy skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you have someone. God, wha's wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with you. But I think maybe, and don't get mad at me, I've said this to you before, you need to stop trying so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't think I do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, so you had a first date last night. Did you bring him a present? Annie is silent.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ann, what did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought him lemon-bars because I was making them anyway, as a friend. Yo're right, that's weird.

dialogues.speaker: DOUGIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: DOUGIE, (O.S)
dialogues.text: I just chipped a nail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I don't know if it's because I'm tired or what, but I wanna kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, just take a deep breath, look in the mirror and remember when I was getting my braces off and farted at the orthodontist. Lillian laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. We need to hang out. 'm coming to Milwaukee this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go to Joni's and pig out and I'll bring some shitty magazines, and I'm gonna spend the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I haven't seen you in months!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow. Bye. They hang up. Dougie is in the doorway wearing her nightie stretched over his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I'm going through some changes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You're an idiot. We see she gets a kick out of him. INT. HARRINGTON'S JEWELRY STORE. Annie enters hurriedly pulling her hair into a bun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry, sorry! I'm here. I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Annie! Thank God. OK people! Gather around me please, in a tight semicircle. Annie and six other employees gather around DONNA.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (slightly overdramatic) Something terrible has happened. Donald will not be coming in to work today. He stepped on a wasp and there is some uncomfortable swelling. Employees mumble.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Annie? Where's your tie? Everyone looks at Annie. She holds it up and starts to put it on.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, I have an eye doctor's appointment that I can't change or they'll will charge me. So someone will have to cover for Donald in engagement rings. Now I-- Annie and SANDY, a male co-worker, shoot their hands the air eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sandy? Today's your day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, my horoscope said I would be presented with an opportunity at work today. That is eerie. That is eerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, that means you'll be alone in keepsakes. You think you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, look out. There might be a bum- rush for letter openers... The employees snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes there is, so....there have been. At times, there has been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright everybody, let's get to work! Saneel?!...OPEN SESAME! SANEEL, the security guard, rolls his eyes and unlocks the doors. Everyone goes to work. Donna gathers her things and starts walking towards the exit with Annie tailing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna, can I talk to you for a second? I feel like if you gave me a shot at engagement rings sometime, I could really-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, what is the calibration of a 2 carat diamond in a standard English setting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made all of that up. None of that was real. I just put words together. You're not ready for the big leagues. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so hard to make commission over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart...did I ever tell you the story of the little paralyzed Chinese girl who wanted to be dancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was paralyzed Annie, had no feeling in her legs, and then one day after years of believing in herself, she stood up out of that chair and tap-danced for the king. On his birthday! My point is, Sandy makes a real effort around here. He connects with the customer. And when he wants to make a sale, he goes for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (beat) I do want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Good. Showing up on time is a wonderful place to start. Donna talks to herself and gathers her things.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uhh! A wasp! Who walks around even their own backyard without at least a thin sandal. It's reckless! Donna exits. A customer passes Anni's section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, can I interest you in a sterling silver money clip that will create memories for you and your family? No? We cut to a HOME IMPROVEMENT SHOW on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: T.V. HOST
dialogues.text: When Dave and Rhonda bought this house, it was a medical clinic. I've never seen so many cupboards! INT. ANNIE AND STEVE'S APT. THAT NIGHT. STEVE, Annie's mid-thirties roommate, sits on the couch shirtless and is enthralled by the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo. That's, that's sooo smart. Annie enters the apartment, tired. She throws her keys down and sifts through her mail. Steve presses mute.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you are, you stayer-out-all- nighter. Did you make out? Sleep over? As Annie heads for her bedroom, he walks towards her room.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't go in the bathroom. Are you going to bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ex-boyfriend got more mail, I did what you said and just threw it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Goodnight Steve! She shuts the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That credit lady called! She wants to talk to you, Annie! She's gonna find you. Steve sits back on the couch, un-mutes the T.V..

dialogues.speaker: ALLEN, (ON SHOW)
dialogues.text: This is where they bagged the animals that didn't make it through the testing. We turned it into a cozy Moroccan reading room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross/Amazing. INT. ANNIE'S BEDROOM. She sits on her bed grabs a âSounds to Relaxâ CD with post-it that reads, âLove, Momâ. She plays it and lie down. We hear a loud Tibetan woma's voice wailing. NOT relaxing. She turns it off and curls up on top of her bed. INT. JONI'S RESTAURANT. THAT FRIDAY NIGHT. Annie and Lillian read magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. God, she's getting really skinny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Your boyfriend just walked in. REVEAL: An orange-skinned BODY BUILDER with HUGE arms and legs in a tiny muscle tank and shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Look, he showed up with your mom. It's a short grey-haired OUTDOORSEY WOMAN in hiking boots. They laugh to themselves. Annie keeps reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool! They're making a WKRP movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here Annie, let me turn the page for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Lillian splays her hand over the magazine showing off a sparkling DIAMOND ENGAGEMENT RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) I just want to help you turn the page of your magazine for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian! What is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He proposed at dinner last night. I wanted to tell you in person and show you this rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Lillian. Oh my God, this is...this is crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Dougie and I have been fighting a lot, but I've been so stressed out with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not I mean. I mean, I remember when we met him at Lake Mills. You lost your virginity to him right in front of me on the dock, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you want to get into who's done what down at the lake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. It's just making me realize how long we've known each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, who better to be my Maid of Honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! I don't know what to say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, you're my best friend. Honestly I didn't even have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, wow. Yes! Of course! Yes! My God. I've never been in a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal, and I don't want to make it one. It's not gonna be a big crazy thing. I wanna keep it simple. (beat) What dessert are you gonna get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're doing. Don't downplay this. I'm happy for you. And someday when hell freezes over and I get married, you can be my Maid of Honor. But for right now, this is about you. OK? This is you're day, and it is a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, but I still don't want this to be a huge production. I just want to have all my friends meet each other, have fun, dance, drink, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's what it'll be. Did you guys set a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, not yet. I don't want a super long engagement, but there's a lot to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you are very fortunate because you happen have the best maid of honor in the whole wide world, and-- Lillian's cell phone rings, she looks at it and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking) Can you hold that thought. I's my fiancee calling. Lillian gets up laughing. Annie laughs along with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo, haha... Annie continues laughing alone. She looks around the room as her smile disappears. She remembers...

dialogues.speaker: DAY.
dialogues.text: Annie and Lillian at 7 years old standing outside eating popsicles, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian Marie Donovan. Do you take your husband, forever, to be your husband? Lillian stands by a poster of Eric Estrada in his C.H.I.P.s uniform that is taped to a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Do you Annie Lucille Walker, take your husband, forever? Reveal Annie standing next to a poster of John Baker from Chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we will leave on our honeymoon to...

dialogues.speaker: SEA WORLD
dialogues.text: The girls rip the posters off of the trees. An old station wagon sits in the dirt driveway. They get in the back seat, look straight ahead and just sit there. END FLASHBACK - BACK TO RESTAURANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The madness has begun. Dougie's parents are having an engagement party for us next Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, in her jogging clothes, reaches for a wedding magazine, but a woman's magazine catches her eye. It

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Ooh, what's this... She finds the article. âHurry, before he gets away! Top five ways to reel him in.â

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. A HOT ATHLETIC GUY with his golden retriever is reaching for a magazine. She can't thing of what to say. She remembers the magazine! It reads â#1. A simple, flirty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: working! Her cell phone rings, she tries to ignore it, but it keeps ringing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Annie!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? It's HELEN (early 30's) Lillian's bridesmaid and friend from the tennis Club. She's a tall leggy blond, all smiles. East coast pretty with a lot of cream cashmere turtleneck sweaters in her closet. She is sitting in a cream colored living room on a huge cream couch with lots of candles glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiiii! This is Helen. I'm one of Lillian's bridesmaids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Helen. Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on being selected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. Annie, reads â#2. Expose your best asset. ASAPâ She panics, starts to elongate her right leg, points her toe, flexes her leg, flips her hair. He seems confused but politely smiles and goes back to his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, yes. Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maid of Honor!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is quite an honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the number one spot. So how many times have you been in the B.P?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, the what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridal Party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never even been in a wedding before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? I've never even heard of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, well, it should be fun. Annie sees that the hot guy is leaving to pay for his magazine! She readsâ#5. Make a funny observational joke that pertains to HIM. (ya know, LIKE SEINFELD!!] Men LOVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and the golden retriever meet eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um Helen, can you hold on for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie covers the phone and approaches the hot guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're dog's really cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kinda funny right? That when girls are ugly, they're called dogs, but dogs are cute. Annie laughs. He half smiles but does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Well, some dogs are ugly. Some girls are ugly. I know a lot of ugly girls. But I'm not friends with them. I've seen a lot of ugly dogs too. But some people I know who are considered dogs, you know, they have a good personality, and are better looking to people cuz of that. And people who are not nice...that's ugly to me. And female dogs are called bitches, that's weird. I'm just kidding. It's a joke. I have better ones. The guy leaves. She hears a voice coming from her phone.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hello?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen! Sorry. Yeah um, I'm really excited for all the wedding stuff and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YAY! OK, I will get your e-mail from Lilly with all of the other girls' information, and when you respond to any wedding related e-mails from now on, just remember to hit âREPLY ALLâ. Did you know there are six of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Lillian told me last night. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can't wait to meet you and hear what your planning for the bachelorette. Any ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. But they are coming, and I will fill you in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oop! There goes my other line. See you Friday! She realizes there might some research to do for this âbridal party' thing. She instead grabs two wedding magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just these. Noticing a magazine by the register that reads â(some b

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this. INT. ANNIE'S APARTMENT. LATER. Annie at her desk reading the wedding magazines. She Googles âMaid-of-Honor dutiesâ. She clicks on a web-s '. She presses âprint', then notices it's 120 pages long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Email DING. She checks her inbox. 48 NEW MESSAGES. âBridesmaids!â, âSo excited to meet you!â, âWed Bells!â,âSuper fun!â,âEngagement party!â âHot Ratesâ,âShoesâ,âShower themesâ âDoes anyone have...â,âCute Favor Ideasâ,âFitness programâ,â âSpecial thoughtsâ âPoem suggestions?â âInvite showerâ âContact list for bacheloretteâ âMaking m âFrench manicures?â etc.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie gets ready as she talks on speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably didn't see you, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie's mom, JUDY, (50's) is on the phone while painting a very lifelike portrait of Wynona Judd from a photograph that's pinned to it's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he saw me alright. He was married to me for fourteen years, he knows what I look like. I'm sure it was because BARB was there. You know how jealous she gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sure that's it mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I on speaker phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to talk this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom I'm running a little late so--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the engagement party. Lillia's getting married, I can't believe how time flies. You're day will come dear. Give Lillian a kiss for me please, and tell Laurie and Ed I just could't afford the plane ticket, but I will be at the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told them, they understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARB could afford to come. Did you know what kind of car she drives now? A 2007 P.T. Cruiser. She looks ridiculous parading all around Fort Myers in that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, Mom--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how she gets in and out of that little car with those big legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get going. I have long drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and honey, I picked you up a couple of things when I was at the Steinmart with Janice so look for a package in the mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom I told you you don't have to send me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh stop. I love doing it. Ok? I love you sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too Mom. Bye. They hang up. Annie walks to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ok, how do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh. You tryin to hook up tonight? A lot of people do at these wedding things you know so you have a good chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the black tights with the black shoes, it's very elongating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think you need more dark up top to balance it out, do have any black beads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at herself] That's actually a good idea. She starts to leave but sees a guilty look and some frosting on Steve's face. She looks over at her saran- 's.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How many moonpies have you eaten? Tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um......two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, now really tell me the truth. How many did you eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four. Nine. They stare at each other. EXT. HIGHWAY. LATER. Annie is finally driving along. she hears sirens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! She pulls over. OFFICER RHODES approaches, chewing gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon ma'am, You in a hurry to get out of the city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Was I speeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that even possible in this rig? He finds this funny, Annie does't.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know funny thing about brake lights, you're supposed to have âem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh. Yeah. Mine are out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you're headin' up Witches Curve. That's a risky move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I usually only drive in the city and they've never pulled me over. To tell you the truth, those lights have been out for like a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, easy hot-dogger. That is not something you wanna go broadcasting to a police officer. I might feel obligated to give you a yea's worth of tickets now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No.. I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just admitted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You admitted it. (beat) Yeah, I can't do that though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm really sorry. I promise I will get the lights fixed tomorrow morning. I'm kind of in a hurry. I'm going to my best friend's engagement party, I'm the Maid of honor and so I really -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. My little sister was just in a wedding. She lost some of her hair from the stress. Again, not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I getting a ticket? He searches for words. She's cute and he wants to keep her there. He keeps smiling. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. That's what happens when you break the law. Um...license and registration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. He writes a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching for words) Ooo, I like that air freshener. Did you get that at the gas station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like Christmas. (sniff) Yeah, it smells like Christmas. He rips the ticket off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here you go. And just so you know it's a just a fix-it ticket. So if you get those lights repaired, you wo't have to pay anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, are those moon-pies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Oh, those are my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (mumbling) Those are my favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's too much trouble, they look all wrapped up. She doesn't get the hint. He really wants one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, have fun at your party. Annie drives off. He watches. EXT -THE HUNT CLUB. CHICAGO SUBURB. Annie, a little embarrassed, hands her keys to the valet and grabs the moon-pies. She walks into an elegant country club dining room, lively cocktail party. Music, happy people, etc. She is greeted by Lillia's mom, LAURIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, sweetheart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mrs. Donovan! They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! And you brought your famous moonpies! Laurie takes the tray.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you believe our Lillian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm so happy for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, clue me in. Is there anyone special in your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl. (whisper) Sleep around. I'm serious. Travel the world and try all the cuisine you can. You know what I mean by that, right? MARY, Laurie's friend, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie, where did you get that sweater? It is one-hundred percent out-of-sight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, I got it at Glory Gay's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh. I can't even walk in there. The blouses alone make my wallet open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worth it, though huh? Mary, I want you to meet Lillian's Maid of Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, very special job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Annie Walker. She lived next door to us in Milwaukee until the girls graduated from high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ann!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil! It was nice meeting you Mary. Annie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (TO MARY)
dialogues.text: Her father ran off to Florida with a younger woman who was working at a Chrysler dealership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Judy, never quite got over it. She also ended up moving to Florida to take care of her parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that is tough. Well it's nice Annie and Lillian have stayed friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like sisters.
They continue gabbing as Annie rushes to Lillian. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What's up? Where's Dougie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoking a cigar with my dad. Le's go get a drink. They weave towards the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Dougie, we're getting drinks! They get to the bar and grab glasses of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is so fancy. Dougie's parents belong here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So does Dougie. This is the tennis club I've been playing at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Wow. I guess it's not what I pictured. Lucky you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennis courts are tennis courts if you ask me. But I have met a lot of really cool people here. I can't wait for you to meet the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! So where's this guy you were telling me about? LILLIAN. Oh shoot, Matt's not coming. I guess he got back together with his ex or something. Anyway, Dougie just told me. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is! Dougie picks Annie up and swings her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dougie, be careful. God, you reek! He puts her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, make sure when my fiance gets cold feet you tell her what a great guy I am. He grabs Lillian and kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the cigar scent away) Ugh. Wash your face. She gives in and kisses him. Then says to Annie..

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's go say hi to the rest of the bridal party. They approach LESLIE, Lillian's cousin, late 30's, standing with her husband PAUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie, hi! How are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just squeezed my third kid out last month and I feel like I'm walking around in a fat suit. She swigs beer out of a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep telling her she looks great. (beat) Oh, I'm sorry. Is this your boyfriend? A 30 YEAR OLD AVERAGE GUY with a neckbrace stands behind Annie. Paul goes to shake his hand. She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. (to the guy) Hi. (to them) No. Annie meets DANA who is with her husband Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie this is Dana, we met here in my tennis class. Dana, Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Dana Shig. Its so nice to finally meet you Annie. I've heard so much about you. This is my husband Ernie. ERNIE has just put food in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you just love weddings? I mean, (she starts to cry) I just love like the feeling and...everyone comes together you know? And it's forever! It's a journey, and WE get to go on it too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that's beautiful. I never thought of it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all so amazing. I'm going to make a scrap book for Lillian. Dana takes her camera out then reaches out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Dana and this is my husband Ernie. So...how did you two meet? She refers to a bald man who looks like a chemistry teacher, who is slowly walking by looking for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't know him. He's not with me. He's just passing by. I'm not here with anyone. BECCA stands very close to her husband KEVIN, a good looking stockbroker type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil! Is this Annie?! Annie and Lillian walk over.

dialogues.speaker: BECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi Annie! I'm Becca. I've heard so much about you. This is my husband Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dougie's partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you so excited?! All of this reminds me so much of my wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months now! It was the best day of my life. I'm married now! It's like...I'm just better now! It might sound weird but... I feel legit. Just like, feminine. Look at my nails! Two beautifully french manicured hands with a HUGE 3 carat diamond ring.

dialogues.speaker: BECCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooooops, where are my manners. Hi! I'm Becca Whitman. REVEAL a very smart looking, older African-American MAN standing next to Annie. He is wearing an ascot and smoking a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name's Captain Arnold Dubois. MEGAN is Dougie's sister. An ODDBALL. She looks like she might be at the wrong party. She is single and lovin' it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! Hey! What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got pins in my leg! I fell off a cruise ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was on a singles cruise. It was nighttime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was port-side, having a drink with a gentlemen and old Megan here decided to show off and I tried to climb into one of the lifeboats with my clogs on. I saw a dolphin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Well, I'm glad you're OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Annie. You're single right? You and I are gonna scam on guys this whole time. You and I are gonna party and get naked with guys. This whole time Annie, no bailing. Lillian re-appears, grabs Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann, there you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about what I said Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Annie) I'm saving you. Now I really want to introduce you to Helen. looking around) There she is. In slow motion, a tall and gorgeous HELEN turns to us. She wears a tight, cream-colored, floor-length evening gown. Annie straightens her plastic beads.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Helen, this is Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiii. This is my husband Perry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry owns Atmospheria candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the Starbuck's of the candle world? Those are popping up on every corner. Which one do you own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them. It's the family business, his father started it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow, that's pretty cule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Currently we dominate the U.S. home illumination sector as a whole and six out of seven homes in upscale neighborhoods have one of our products, including the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry donated a few for tonight. The room is all aflame.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how do you like our club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was just telling Lillian i's very elegant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you live in Milwaukee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah in the nice part. I work at Harrington's Jeweler's. I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've heard of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty well-known in the jewelry world. It's got like the biggest market for all the jewelry they sell and 'm actually gonna be getting a promotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so I'm pretty excited about it. It's gonna be...pretty big. So, if you ever need a discount--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're funny. Listen Annie,I know you said you've never been in a wedding before so I just want you to know that we all have, especially me, so if you need any help, don't hesitate to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER. Groomsman DEAN finishes a speech. They are now in the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cheers to you two, our last single friends finally crossing over into the world of marital bliss, welcome to the other side! Dana snaps a photo, crying. Helen approaches the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello everyone. My name is Helen Harris the Third, an honored member of the bridal party. In honor of Lillian and Dougie, I'd like to take this opportunity to read a poem that I penned last summer while I was sitting on a swing at an exclusive resort in Santorini. Annie whispers to the person next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to give a speech? As Helen reads, Annie looks around the room and sees everyone in awe. Dana starts to cry. She reads from a fancy sheet of stationary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every blink of an eye, every kiss of a lip, every stroke of a lovers hand, every...scent of a woman, every breath you take, every move you make. Love conquers all. Annie sees that Lillian is touched. Helen gets emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say when you choose a mate, yo're choosing a best friend. Dougie, yo're a lucky man. Lillian, I know you're going to make a wonderful wife, because you have been the best friend that I could ever ask for. Annie's face goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have never had a friendship like this. I'm so happy you two are finally taking this big step together and I ca't wait for all of the adventures that await us. People are moved, sniffling. Including Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now âDouglyâ, sorry, inside joke. You better not keep my Lil on a leash. I still need my drunken nights at Rockin Sushi! TO DOUGIE AND LILLIAN!!! The crowd erupts with laughter and applause. People are crying, hugging, and standing.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you! Now wher's Annie? Annie? Stand up Annie. The room looks around. Annie slowly rises.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There she is. Annie is our Maid of Honor everyone. And I'm sure she'd like to take this time to say a few words. Annie? Annie stands up to the applause. The room falls silent as she walks to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, hello everybody. Hi everyone. 'm Annie. Wow, it really smells like vanilla in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the candles Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Megan. Lillian this is gonna be awesome. Um, uh, God, oh, oh, oh, what's that saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayay, um, God, um, what is it? It's a good one, a good saying, it's Irish. It's like a-like a toast. Is it Irish? Something about a road...Oh God, 'm blanking. So I'll just say I'm so happy to be a part of this whole celebration and happiness. You two are so happy together and hope you have a happy lifetime of happiness and celebrating. And I love you and....Lillian, w've been best friends since we were like 5...'ve never been to Greece... 't know if she's done. Annie sees Helen has moved over to sit next to Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (SINGING)
dialogues.text: âDid you ever know that you're my hero...You're everything I wish I could be..â C'mon you guys know the words. Some people reluctantly sing along.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: âI could fly higher then an eagle. For you are the wind beneath my wings. Flyyy, flyyyyy, so fly into the sky, so fly until we touch up high--â EXT-COUNTRY CLUB. LATER. Lillian and Annie are at the valet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, tell me I didn't sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you sang. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I don't know, I was just maybe a little out of my element, and after Helen's speech--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so embarrassed. What did you think of your engagement party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides the impromptu concert from Bette Midler, it was perfect. They laugh and hug.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I gotta go say bye to some people I do't know. Drive safe. Lillian goes back inside. Helen appears out of thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! Great job tonight..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling slightly mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nononono. Not at all. Everyone gets a little nervous and carried away during those kind of things. So listen, 've been brainstorming some theme ideas for Lillian's shower. I was thinking somewhere along the lines of Alice in Wonderland meets...are you ready? Hollywood. And for the bachelorette? Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't I supposed to be planning some of these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, I hadn't heard from you and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just got engaged two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I figured since you don't have any experience that you might get overwhelmed by events of this caliber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, I'm pretty capable. I think I can handle it. A guest walks by and taps Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, you left your poem inside. You have beautiful cursive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The guest says nothing to Annie and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Annie, I didn't mean I didn't think you couldn't do it. I'm sure you are aware of all your duties. We'll see--we'll see you soon. Helen walks away. A OLD LADY passes by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Annie! Megan is running towards her with a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Annie wait! I wanna give you my numbers. A place just opened up near my house. From 4-7 every weekday, Karaoke, two dollar wings and all you can eat MAN sandwiches if you know what I mean. Annie is nervous, starts biting her nails. INT. âSEXY NAIL' NAIL SALON. NEXT DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your nail too short for french manicure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ok. I fix for you. Make you sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great! INT. HARRINTON'S. DONNA'S OFFICE. LUNCHTIME. Donna and Annie are eating lunch in the break-room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they put a solution in my eyes to dilate them, which caused temporary blindness and with the loss of my sight, my hearing became bionic. Do you need some help dear? Annie struggles to open a bag of chips but her new ULTRA LONG, french-manicured nail-tips are making it very hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA'S OFFICE. CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Annie and Donna are doing inventory. Annie gets text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Well, it's official. Lillian set a date. October tenth. Why did I just get a stomach ache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous. It's not all on your shoulders. Doesnt she have other bridesmaids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and they've all done this before so I'm feeling a little pressure. I have to make this really nice for Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could help. Weddings are a lot different now then they were in my day. They look at Donna's wedding picture on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dress is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have it. I was hoping my daughter Elizabeth would wear it but when she and Alice had their âceremonyâ they both wanted to wear suits. (beat) Ok, we need two Shannisburg tennis bracelets. Annie struggles to write with her nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. Hold on a sec, hard to write...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're very long. INT. SEXY NAIL. THAT NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I need to make these shorter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not sexy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's... I can't work with them so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. 7 dollar for file. No more sexy though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short nail is ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. INT. ANNIE'S BEDROOM. Annie looks up different bridesmaid dress shops EXT. âOCCASIONZ' BRIDAL SHOP. DAYTIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, Occasionz. I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone this is Occasionz, supposedly it's you know, one of the best bridal shops in town, so, that's cool. Oh and also, there's a restaurant inside, so um, I figured, we could maybe have lunch after. So, let's go! She goes to the door. It is locked. She sees a buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't see that. She presses the buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, we're hear to see some bridesmaids dresses.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Annie.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: (snotty) What's the reservation name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls) Oh, she must be talking about the restaurant. (back into the intercom) No, we're here to look at dresses.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: I heard you the first time. So I take it you don't have a reservation for the dress shop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) You didn't make a reservation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no, I'm sorry, I didn't know I had to make a reservation for that. Sorry! Anyway, we're all out here now and--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: The next available appointment for bridesmaid fittings is in seven weeks and we don't take reservations over the intercom so you'll have to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven weeks?!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry maybe you can't hear me. I just said a few seconds ago that we do't have a reservation for the next seven weeks.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when you make your reservation do't forget you'll also need to make an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) You didn't make an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can hear you. Would it be possible for you to make an exception for us because we drove all the way out here and I didn't know about the reservation/ appointment thing so...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, we can go somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. I'll work it out. Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This really is the best place though, that's the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I know the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom] Hello, this is the manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can fit you in seven weeks, that is all we have available. We only take parties that have a reservation and that have made an appointment over the phone. I'm going to ask you to not buzz in again. Thank you. Byyyyyyye. Helen approaches the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Yes? Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whit, it's Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen?! Hiiii!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiiii!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Listen, I'm out here with a whole bunch of girls and we had a little miscommunication and our reservation- appointment wasn't made. Is there any way to fit us in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say no more. Buzzzzzzzz. The girls happily enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto} Wow, thanks Helen. INT. âOCCASIONZ' BRIDAL SHOP. DAYTIME. Whitney and Helen are leading the girls down the hall. Lillian and Annie tail the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann, don't worry about it. We got in. Annie sees racks of wedding dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want to sneak off and look at the wedding dresses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Annie, I didn't tell you? Guess who Helen is friends with? Lady Lavonia Jean St. Petsois JuJu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That famous wedding dress designer tha's in all those wedding magazines? As a favor to Helen she's going to design my dress for almost nothing. Normally they're like twenty grand. She's French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to send my measurements to France. Annie is a little disappointed. INT. BRIDESMAIDS DRESS ROOM. They all stand in a room stuffed bridesmaids dresses. Lillian's cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise, surprise. It's my Mom. Mom? Can you hold on a second? She covers the phone and talks to the girls.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Start looking at dresses. I'll be right back. I think maybe you guys should decide anyway and pick out something you like since you're the ones wearing it. Cool? (nodding) Have fun! What's up Mom? Ugh! They're booked? Lillian leaves talking to her Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok ladies, start your (french) engines! Shots of dresses being pulled off of the racks. Fighting for the same dress, shirts coming off, dresses zipped up the back and dresses not fitting, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie loves the dress she has on. She talks to herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi I'm Annie. Can I get a martini? What you mean you need to see I.D.? (giggling)

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY. UPSCALE PARTY. LIKE AN OVERDRAMATIC PERFUME AD.
dialogues.text: Annie, in the dress, is talking to the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, with that dress on you look about... .eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Annie laughs. And turns away right into, a GORGEOUS male model in a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: HOT MAN IN TUX
dialogues.text: Excuse me, you dropped an earring. An UNDERWEAR MODEL appears, in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it for her.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN SURGEONS SCRUBS
dialogues.text: No I will!

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN RED BATHING SUIT
dialogues.text: I'll get it! I'm a lifeguard. Tons of men begin to yell and fight over her. The chaos forces Annie to make a DRAMATIC EXIT from the CASTLE. She runs down the stairs like Cinderella into the forest. They men begin to chase her. She runs through the trees out of breath, she is face to face with a sexy, sweaty, lumberjack, wh's chopping wood. It's CHRISTIAN BALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Christian Bale. I'm just chopping some wood, I like to do that between movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Christian. They hear the voices of the men from the party screaming for her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Christian! I need a place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, get inside my muscles. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN BALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love this sash. They look into each others' eyes, just about to kiss and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Annie! INT. ANNIE'S DRESSING ROOM. Helen has flung open Annie's dressing room curtain, putting an abrupt end to her fantasy. She is wearing cream colored lingerie, showing off her TOTALLY amazing body. Annie is uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your cute little boobies. Ooh, is that the dress you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think it will look good on everybody, it has a sash--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sash? Annie, this isn't the Sound of Music tryouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I told you Becca I can't wear strapless!

dialogues.speaker: BECCA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why not?! Annie and Helen come out to see all the bridesmaids arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you two shut your traps? No one's going to be looking at us. Le's just get the one with the shawl, 'm always freezing at these things anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta say I'm still leaning towards the one that I found. It is a very ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what about this one? Everybody stops and looks at Annie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think it would be flattering on everyone and we could totally wear it again. The sash comes in different colors not just this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone! We can't all have the dress that we want. I've been in a lot of weddings and when choosing a bridesmaid dress, you must ask yourself, âIf invited, would I wear this a dress to...The ACADEMY AWARDS!â

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo, I never thought of it that way. All the girls agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that in mind, I say we wear this one. Helen holds up a dress. The girls like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or this one! People wear sashes to the Academy Awards all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if they're nominated for the Sound of Music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Lillian would like this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think Lillian would like THIS one. Lillian walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I'm hearing lots of excitement in here. She touches Helen's dress.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oooo, I like this one. What about you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it. Right guys? The girls all agree. Except Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Let's eat! Helen dumps the dress in Annie's arms and follows Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it might look best in cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, good idea. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was easy. The girls head back to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This dress is almost $500!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not too bad/that sounds about right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's what I'm saying. That's a great price.
EXT. âOCCASIONZ RESTAURANT' BRIDAL-THEMED CAFE. PATIO. Andrea Bocceli music playing. Waiters in tuxes etc. The girls sit at a beautiful table looking at men's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is kind of amazing. I did't even know it existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The southwestern cobb is really good. I come here and eat sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, there's a fly that really likes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They only have salads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Annie, what's your deal? Are you dating anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Not right now. I had a boyfriend for three years but we broke up like six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I hate to hear stuff like that! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the guy who stole a bunch of money from you and gave you an STD? Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lillian told me. Annie shoots Lillian a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I was just talking about you cause I was worried about you and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's fine. But he didn't steal the money, I loaned it to him. And HPV is really common right now. Everyone looks around.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Around fifty percent of sexually active men and women acquire HPV at some point in their lives and by age fifty, eighty percent of women will be infected with a genital HPV infection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 6.2 million new cases of HPV affect Americans each year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, it's on the butter you guys. The fly's on the butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very few HPV infections show any signs or symptoms. Therefore a lot of infected people don't even know they have it, yet they transmit the virus to their sexual partner. Silent. Everyone is a little grossed out..

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, it's fine, the past is the past. We weren't meant to be. My last pap-smear came back normal so that's cule. But you know, I'm dating, here and there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anyone in mind to bring to the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't even think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs a date? Just go stag and make out with someone there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanna meet a nice man, Annie, you should come to karaoke night at my church. We sing hymns to rock beats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I have the perfect guy for you Annie. Mike Donahue. He went to school with Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike from the fourth of July last year? Ooh, I've seen him Ann. He's hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kevin said he just sold his company for an embarrassing amount of money. But he's totally down to earth. You guys have to meet. I'm texting Kevin right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Mike too. Megan is digging a dead fly out of the butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fly just committed suicide. Death by butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, if you guys got married you could live out here and see us all the time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and then pop out a couple kids, sit around and talk about nothing while your vagina flaps in the wind like a wet paper towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Oooh, I didn't know we were going to hear that word at lunch today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was set up with Ernie. As soon as I met him, I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Annie, you never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is lost in thought. She hears. Sirens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Come on! She pulls over. Officer Rhodes approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see your still driving around with busted tail lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, money's been tight and...I forgot(laughing). You're not gonna give me another ticket for that are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah... The reason I pulled you over today, is that--(searching) you were driving too slow. Backing up traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. You were going ten miles under the speed limit. That's a moving violation. It's...underdriving. It's in the books. But, I'm just going to give you a warning this time, but I do have to um...write some stuff down on a piece of paper. He begins to write. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man I'm hungry. I'm doing the Master Cleanse. You ever heard of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cayenne pepper water for three days now. It's supposed to clean you out, make you feel lighter. It's working. The only problem is I get so hungry. I just want a big slab of ribs. You ever crave that kind of stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about cravings right now. I am PMS'ing like crazy. It's taking everything in me not to stop and the store and get like three kit-kats and a bottle of wine. I'm so irritable right now. They stare at each other out of awkwardness.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's OK, I've got three sisters. We had tampons in the pencil drawer. Sometimes my friends and I would say they were cigars and smoke'em. (beat) Okay. I have finished writing down the things I need to write, on this paper. OH! He hands her a business card.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a buddy of mine. Owns a body shop in Milwaukee. Might be able to help you out for a good price with those taillights. I'll write my name on here so you can tell him who referred you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my name right there. In case you forgot it from last time. It's Nathan Rhodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Annie. I'll get those fixed. I get paid next week. Bye! She drives off. Rhodes wishes he had been more suave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I've been in the jewelry business for a long time. Nothing says âI'm sorry for your loss' like a sterling silver money clip. An OLD WOMAN CUSTOMER looks at her stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We also have yo-yos you can engrave. In memory of...um, what's your friend's name? The old woman walks away as Sandy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paychecks. Here you go Annie. She and Sandy open their checks.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I scored this week. 'm gonna buy Sharita a new Panasonic telephone. It's cordless and has intercom. What about you Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pay for a cream-colored gown that I'll never wear again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is on the phone as she gets ready for her date with Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! I can't find anything to wear for my date with Mike tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Shoot, I can't talk now. I'm with Helen and we have a conference call with Lady Lavonia Jean St. Petsois JuJu about my dress. Ugh. I'm so sorry. She's calling! I gotta go. Have fun! Lillian hangs up. Steve walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That credit lady called you again. I told her you were at the tailors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm going on a date. This? (holds up a dress) or this? (what she's wearing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like those pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give you four corners. Annie's not following.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's when a girls butt looks like it has four corners. It's not a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. These are my only clean pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a tube skirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. If you stand like you are right now facing that angle, it looks good. She looks in the mirror again, grabs her bag and leaves. INT. THAI RESTAURANT. THAT NIGHT. BAR AREA. Annie sits next to Mike Donahue. He is tall, dark and handsome. They have cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an expert in corporate real- estate but I've always been interested in it. So, yeah I totally agree. Mike smiles, he is cute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit, I told Becca 'm not really keen on set-ups. I know i's early, but so far so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks again for coming from Milwaukee, I know it's quite a drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that drive in my sleep these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time maybe I'll come to you. Annie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have got great teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I brush'em every day. She flashes her teeth. The hostess comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tables ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally! Mike guzzles down his cocktail as they read their menus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know about you but since we're at a Thai restaurant, I'm gonna try the dog. Mike laughs at his own joke and continues drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Becca tells me you play a lot of tennis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to squeeze in a game now and then. We should play sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah I haven't rea--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my game's pretty solid. I did win a couple tournaments at the club. I tend to- Jesus Christ! (whispers) It smells like B.O. in here huh? I think it's the people. A very effeminate waiter brings them their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here ya go. I'll be back to take your order in two secs. I'm swamped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, get a load of our waiter. 'm surprised he didn't put pink umbrellas in our drinks... Annie laughs, but is a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or AIDS. Mike laughs. Annie is HORRIFIED. Mike swigs from his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, AIDS is crazy. You do't have it do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Neither do I... He raises his eyebrows up and down at her. LATER. Annie hasn't touched her food. He's eating with his hands and drunk. Other patrons are beginning to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I started to get a little chub, you know what that is. How could I not with those huge canteloupes waving in my face. Anyway, I looovee massages, am I right? As he's laughing he lets out a huge burp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still laughing) Whoa-ho! Excyuuuuse me! I got that from Steve Martin. Still laughing, he pats his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. I forgot my wallet. EXT. MINI-MART. LATER THAT NIGHT. Annie's car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is on the phone, looking at the herbal drinks. âCalmâ âFocusâ âSex Appealâ âLeanâ. She f âCalmâ. RHODES appears holding a bag of mini carrots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's me, I just had to tell you about my night. Oh my God. Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie Walker. I thought I heard your car out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, Officer...Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones? Oh boy. Guess somebody thought he was a little more memorable than he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sorry. I'm a little out of it. I'm not drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ok. Call me Rhodes. (notices her drink) Trying to get âcalmâ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Recovering from a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish your cleanse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, trying to wean myself back to the really bad foods I like eating. EXT - MINIMART. CONTINOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the drink. (beat) So are you one of those cops that sits in that same spot everyday and sneaks up on people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people get up to high speeds on this road. I tell people its better to pay for a ticket than have your family pay for a funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a very good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a carrot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are leaning on the back of his car eating carrots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew! What is this? Annie pulls out a very dry, warped discolored carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you got the ugly carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one in every bag. You should eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think you should eat it. The're your carrots. He goes to eat it. She grabs it out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no! Don't eat it! EW!!! She throws it on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't litter. He picks it up. INT. RHODES' POLICE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've ever wanted to get of out a restaurant faster in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't go on blind dates. It seems unnatural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what am I going to tell my friends who set us up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're probably right. Now Rhodes and Annie are driving in his police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an ok job. It's commission, so it's unpredictable. I don't know, I always wanted to finish my bachelor's but that's kind of financially impossible right now. Plus I'd feel like ninety around all those college students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my dad used to say that life is like a hallway of doors. You can stand at the same door forever if you want. Or you can open a different door. And that one may not be the right door, but i'll open up a whole new hallway of doors. Anyway, it worked for me. I was kinda lost and I opened a door and the next thing I knew I was a cop. And I love my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. I think I get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you can always sell moon-pies by the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonpies. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke. You had moon-pies in your car the first time I pulled you over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FAST FOOD RESTAURANT COUNTER. LATER
dialogues.text: They are waiting in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get married I don't want the kind of wedding people have these days. I want it to be like a carnival. You know dunk tanks? People win prizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you can have elephants, trapeze artists and a big scale to guess the bride's weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, first of all that's a circus wedding and I'm talking about a carnival wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (to clerk) Yeah I'll have the number four, and can you make that Super Biggie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are sitting in the restaurant, mouths full of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
