dialogues.text: And then she moved to Hawaii and now lives with a guy who sells shaved ice. And supposedly she has really long armpit hair now. That's pretty much the last girlfriend I had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, lets just say my last boyfriend that I lived with broke up with me over the phone. Then come to find out, he had borrowed $30,000 in my name without telling me, putting me in horrible debt that I'm still paying off. Because I can't find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You win. ANNIE'S CAR. CONTINUOUS. Annie in her car, engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh. It's twelve thirty! I should probably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, before you go. There is something I want to give you. I was gonna wait but, I think you'll want this now. He jokingly gives her the ugly carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I know you've had a terrible night. He gives it to her. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, one sec. Hello? Ted!? Hey! Oh my gosh! No,no. Can you hold on a sec? She waves at Rhodes and mouths...

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I'll see you around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don't forget about those taillights. They're really starting to bug me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K. Bye.(to Ted) So, you're in town? EXT - TED'S HOUSE. NEXT MORNING. He opens the front door, leading Annie out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I won't call so late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was fine. Like I said, I mean I was just driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome. It's cool that we can just hookup and whatever. No strings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. I love it. I feel good right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Bye. EXT. GAS STATION. CONTINUOUS. Annie pulls in, her tank is way passed empty. She looks in her purse frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!! No! No! I left my fucking credit card at the restaurant! Shit! She picks up her phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi, Donna, it's Annie. Um, sorry but I just ran out of gas and I'm gonna be a little bit late. Yes, I know, 'm really sorry. I will get there as soon as I can. I promise, I'm so sor---hello? INT. HARRINGTON'S JEWELRY STORE. Annie comes running onto the floor putting her tie on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, hi! I almost left, but they said that you were coming and that you were late. Helen is standing there looking gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had to come into Milwaukee for a charity luncheon right down the street and I thought I'd come in and say hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the leader of the bridesmaids, I thought it'd be fun to pick up some little gifts for all the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leader of the bridesmaids? Um, wouldn't that technically be me? Honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, sweetie, you're the Maid of Honor, and we're all bridesmaids, and out of all of us, I'm the leader. Anyway, it doesn't matter. Um, I wanted to get something that we could wear to the rehearsal dinner or something. That would be fun. Where are the diamonds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, what about a nice pen..or a tortoise-shell handled sterling silver letter opener? No? Ok, let me get Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! And Annie we really need to start planning the bachelorette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. I'm on it. Got some ideas. So I'll let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't wait. INT. ANNIE'S APT. THAT NIGHT. Annie arrives home from work frazzled to find Steve on the couch watching the same Home Improvement show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, well I have never seen a transformation like this. This old tour bus is stunning.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL ON SHOW
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. (to Annie) You got another package from your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey thanks for saving my butt today. Like I said I'll pay you back as soon as I can. She opens the package. And pulls out a red blazer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. But you should always put gas in when it gets to a quarter tank. Especially cause you have such a shitty car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Can I ask you a question? What do you think of Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo. Let me turn this off. Vegas is a black hole but I must have it in my life. Does that make sense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just asking because some of the girls are talking about going for Lillia's bachelorette party and I've never been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. Now I don't know about weddings. When you go on a bachelorette, does the bride pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, everyone pays for themselves. And you pay for the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, I'm gonna say no. You cannot afford that. Vegas is not cheap. Airfare, hotels, food, cars, drinks, clubs, show tickets. Remember this morning? You cannot afford Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could save up for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you need to win a contest to go to Vegas/You had gum for lunch yesterday. Ooh, âNight Moves.â Can I have this? A lightbulb goes off in Annie's head. Steve holds the blazer out and reads the tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you I'd pay you back! Annie runs into her room. She sits down at the computer and begins typing feverishly. We see these words: âDear bridal partyâ, âgreat ide âbachelorette partyâ, âFloridaâ, âSea World!â place to stay!â. She presses send, and is very pleased. The phone immediately rings.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiiiii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Helen. Helen is dressed in cream under a cream blanket. All around her is a ridiculous amount of white glowing candles. There are too many flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got your e-mail. Um...Sea World?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's not just Sea World. It's a weekend in Florida. See, when Lillian and I were kids we went there and she loved it and has always talked about going back. Ask Dougie. I think it would really mean a lot to her. We could stay at my Dad's house, he won't even be there. Then we could go out at night and got to the beach and then Sea World on one of the days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a bachelorette at Sea World?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, Sea World would just be a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have been talking to the other girls, and I was thinking we should go to Las Vegas! Annie's other line rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, can you hold on? That's my other line. She clicks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Annie. It's Becca. Becca, in her shabby-chic home office paints a front porch sign that says âThe Whitman'sâ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just looking at your e-mail, yo're so cute. Sea World. What about Turkey? That's where we went for for MY bachelorette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, Turkey's really far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's super old though! They have awesome restaurants. It's very exotic. Have you ever seen Aladdin? It totally looks like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on... Annie clicks back over to Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, I'm sorry can I call you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few minutes. I'll call you back. Annie clicks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becca?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. You know, if you wanna go some place closer than Turkey. Helen JUST e-mailed me about going to Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. Everybody always goes to Vegas. It seems just cliche to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never get sick of it. I love blackjack. I have a system. Annie's other line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my other line's ringing. Can I call you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. Annie clicks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, it's Dana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is.. Dana is on her porch swing drinking lemonade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your idea about Sea World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but then Helen just called me and said we should go to Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Vegas is so hot, don't you think? It's like, hot and dry. People get sick there all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had that experience. My skin always clears up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just think it's probably not-- Hold on. (clicks over) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, it's Megan. Megan is at work, in front of a wall of computer and television screens. It is a technical haven, looks like NASA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk right now, but I was thinking for the bachelorette, something more along the lines of a personal challenge weekend. Have you ever heard of the Nevada Project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defeated) No. Leslie in her Sopranos style living room on a treadmill. Her kids run around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta be honest. I've been married for nine years, this may be the last bachelorette party of my career and I want the sweaty nuggets of a gay man pounding me in the face at some point during this trip. I'll pay whatever I have to pay. (to the kids) Tyler stop it, put that back! Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vegas has these party busses that have flat screens in them and dance floors--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we could take hummer limos around everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds really expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh but it's gonna be so much fun! Besides money shouldn't be a problem if Lillian's our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, I was just thinking about everyone else. That's all I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is, they drop you off in the middle of the desert. You have to kill your own food and find your way back. Not everyone makes it. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. I want balls in my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I think Vegas is a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree with Helen. Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know what else is in Nevada? Vegas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls. Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vegas it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Holy Shit Annie! We're goin' to Vegas! INT - JEWELRY STORE. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eating a cookie) No can do, I need all my shifts. 'm trying to save up and take my lady to Maui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, one day a week, just for a little while. I've already asked everybody else. I really need the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. My hands are tied. Sharita's got my dick in a chip-clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Mm. These are the best peanut butter titties you ever made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're called peanut butter kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what they look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridesmaids sit in first class. In the distance, Annie's head pops up from her seat in row 3O of coach. EXT. AIRPORT. LAS VEGAS. The girls wait by the curb with their luggage. Megan appears next to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. The city of lust. Annie, do you know how many men are looking for trouble in this town right now? We are gonna nail it down. We should tell everybody we're twins cause guys looking up with twins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've heard that. Ok everybody! You guys, hey we're here, we're in Vegas! Woo! Lillian walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, come here. Why didn't you tell me you weren't sitting with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's no big deal. I didn't want to blow all my money on a first class ticket. I'm here though, right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, you guys, gather around. Welcome to Lillian's bachelorette party! We should probably get a bunch of cabs and head to our beautiful hotel, The New Marquis Royal Suites... As Annie's talking, a limo pulls up behind her. âThe Ne Marquis Royal Suites.â

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian, look what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You guys, is this for us?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a limo from the hotel. We're in Vegas! Yaaaay!! They all pile into the limo, excitedly talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, everyone just get in the car. Got a ride to the hotel. It's taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside the limo) Sit by me, Annie!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE NEW MARQUIS ROYAL SUITES. LATER
dialogues.text: The girls' excited talking continues into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hotel is amazing! You guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Lillian, you're staying with me in the master suite. It's all set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Okay! Then party in room 812 in one hour! (waving her key) UPSTAIRS. HOTEL HALLWAY. CONTINUOUS. Girls get off the elevator, giddy with excitement. Annie gets back into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh! Shoot! I left my sunglasses downstairs. Ugh! Where's my head? EXT. HOTEL. CONTINUOUS. Annie sneaks out, rolling her bag. She catches a cab. EXT. HOTEL RICK. LATER. Cab pulls up to a tiny broken down building. A sign reads âHotel Rick. Vacancy. Some T.V.s.â An old man rides a bicycle in circles in the parking lot, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobby is very outdated. Wood panel walls etc., The hotel brochure is on the desk. It is probably the picture she saw online, it does NOT look the same. The clerk enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I have a reservation for Walker. RICK, an East Indian man, stands behind the desk in front of a large portrait of himself, posed exactly as he is now, with the same outfit. He holds the pose, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, two nights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Rick waits for her to notice the painting, but she never does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want towels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need sheets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pillow though, ok? Annie just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to reveal a gorgeous huge feminine suite.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN AND LILLIAN
dialogues.text: (gasp) OH MY GOD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie opens her door holding unfolded sheets and towels. The room is very ugly, bare mattress, lots of brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan and Leslie stand in their grande bathroom. Hot tub, plush towels, flat screen T.V. Candles burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He-llo Vegas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an old toothbrush and comb by the dirty sink, a pair of athletic socks hanging over the shower rod where a curtain should be. There is a cat staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and Becca open their curtains revealing a spectacular view. They scream and jump up and down. INT. HOTEL RICK. Annie opens up her curtains to a back lot. Something is on fire! Rick tries to put it out. The old man rides by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams in shock) INT. THE NEW MARQUIS ROYAL SUITES. THAT NIGHT. Annie stands outside room 312. She is dressed more preppy than she's ever looked. She knocks on the door. Becca opens it. We see disco lights and hear rap music. There are shirtless male waiters, penis balloons and a slide show of naked men. The room looks like a sex club. The girls are dressed like borderline prostitutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, Annie's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooooooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this amazing? Lillian runs over and hugs Annie, wearing a condom veil and drinking out of a penis straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! I wanna see a drink in your hand in one minute! Lillian pulls Annie into the room. Helen is getting off of the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok you guys, change of plans. The Velour Cobra had an opening at 9 so I got us a dinner reservation. Isn't that radical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woohooo/Ooooh/Alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Cool. Alright Everyone raises their glasses. The night has begun.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE VELOUR COBRA. CLUB RESTAURANT -LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Annie is concentrating on the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, mine was...great, got it. Becca scoots in next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, I didn't get a chance to ask you, how was your date with Mike? Give me all the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, um, we had dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you'll go out with him again? He told Kevin he thought you were really great and hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from her end of the table) Hey wha's the damage down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I got it right here, I figured out what I owe so, should I just pass it around?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE, (TO ANNIE)
dialogues.text: Why don't we just all split it? It's so much easier.

dialogues.speaker: BECCA,DANA,HELEN,MEGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah/Just split it/Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's probably just easier...just split it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me see it. Ok.. .It's a hundred each plus tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I had soup and ice water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus we're paying for Lillian...everyone just put $125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) No alcohol...or any real food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll all even out by the end of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it even out? How does that happen? Everyone, including Annie, puts in their money. Helen moves over to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you everybody!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, don't tell Lillian, it's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend Sean Michael works for a promotional company and they're having this big event tonight at Tara Rei's stepbrother's Club, Sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it should be our first stop. H's reserving seats for us in the VIP section. It's a $150 cover and there's a one bottle champagne minimum of $750 per table, he said people from the Real World go in there all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were going to the Jungle Lounge after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are. After that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...um...wow. Awesome. Here's the thing I was going to stop by the hotel, the Marquis Suites. I think I ate something weird on the plane probably, my stomac's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well we're only gonna be there for an hour or so, you can just meet up with us after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just text you when we're getting ready to leave. I hope you feel better. Lillian comes up already a little tipsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, Leslie spilled the beans. Le's get our asses over to Sacrifice. What are we waiting for? Wooooooo! Lillian looks at Helen's legs.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa. Helen, turn around. Are those those Ransom Jeans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell Perry I bought them,I ordered them from New York. They're insanely expensive. But I gotta tell you guys the compliments I get on my ass make them worth every penny. She sticks her butt out. Lillian slaps it and all the girls laugh. She is the life of the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party bus pulls up. As the doors open, dry ice pours out. Inside there's a disco ball, dance poles, crazy lights. The girls all scream and run onto the bus. With the commotion, no one notices that Annie stays behind. INT. CASINO. LATER. Annie enters casino alone, sadly weaves through the slot machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: âMy Prerogativeâ by Bobby Brown comes on VERY LOUD ma conversation difficult. Lillian looks around for Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Annie our song! Wher's Annie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Annie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!(to Helen) Where's Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's meeting us later!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lillian) Oh. She's meeting us there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie HAS DIARRHEA!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she okay?! Should I call her!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine! She's gonna meet us in an hour, it's all set! (to the other girls]

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE HAD REALLY BAD DIARHEA
dialogues.text: They continue partying, drinking, dancing. INT. CASINO. Annie passes four fun college age party guys at a craps table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no wait. Wait. (to Annie) Hey, will you roll for me? Can she roll for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if she's playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? What do I have to roll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything but a seven or eleven, as many times as you can. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dave. This is Brian, Brian and Mark. Ok Annie, do your thing. Annie rolls a four. The guys all cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Four! Annie rolls again, another four. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, four! Holy shit, two fours. One more time, third time's a charm! Annie rolls again. Another four. She ca't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four! Ahhhhhhhhh! (giddy laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! Annie! Annie! Annie gets a text message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hold on. You guys, my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cell phones at the tables m'am. Its a casino rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go outside then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you gotta play the game out. You have to finish your roll. She continues to roll all fours. The guys scream. EXT. CASINO. A HALF HOUR LATER. The guys are carrying Annie on their shoulders, cheering for her. She is laughing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, guys put me down, put me down. Whoa, that's my breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. She reads a text message from Helen. âWe're leaving Sacrifice. It's boring. Meet us at the Jungle Loungeâ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you guys. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here with a bunch of friends and 'm supposed to meet them at this club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We love clubs! We'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we'll get your cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ok. As the cab drives away, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN 1, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude, we gotta get Brian some food asap. I've seen that look before.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAB. PARKING LOT IN FAST FOOD RESTAURANT. LATER
dialogues.text: Everyone eats huge burgers including the driver (not Annie, she is annoyed!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys almost done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry we haven't eaten all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have NEVER seen a drive-thru line like that dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because of the concert. They continue eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab is pulled over, all the guys are outside, peeing. Annie gets a text from Lillian. âThe Jungle Lounge is awesome! We need to dance. P.S. It's RAINING in here! WHERE ARE YOU? Xoxo Lilâ She texts back, âOn my way!â

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge fist fight is going on in the car, yelling etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much further?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I know? How do you think I know? EXT. JUNGLE LOUNGE. Annie and the guys get out of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. We can't go into this place. We got kicked out last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what'd I tell you guys?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, it's ok, we're just goin next door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Annie, here's your cut of the craps money. Eight hundred bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won big for us tonight. Buy your friends a round of drinks and come next door after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, bring your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Roller!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woohoo/Yeah/ The Roller!/Annie! They all high five. Annie turns to bouncer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. One please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here ya go. INT. JUNGLE LOUNGE. Annie walks through the club. She calls Lillian. No answer. She gets a a drink. Time passes. Her phone rings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. I'm here! Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean here, where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the Jungle Lounge, where are you guys? This place is huge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen I can't hear you! We had to leave the Jungle Lounge, Becca--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet us at the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?!! INT. PARTY BUS. Loud music. Lillian tries to call Annie back. Annie tries to call Lillian back. They both get voice-mails. Annie gives up. It starts pouring rain on her inside the club. Everyone jumps up and screams with excitement. Thunder! CLUB D.J. Me Tarzan, you Jane. It's time for the dance spotlight. If it lands on you, you gotta shake it! The spotlight immediately lands on a soaking wet Annie. She dances very angrily. Jungle dancers dance very close to her and put vines around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's back/ the Roller!/ Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roller, I can't stand seeing you like this. (to bartender] Get this fine lady a shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have two lemon drops. INT BAR. HALF HOUR LATER. Annie and Dave are wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying. Some people have everything and others have just little bits of things. It's not fair. I don't get it.....I mean I think I hate Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the sexiest think anyon's ever said. INT. ANNIE'S ROOM. HOTEL RICK. In the dark, Annie and Dave are passionately making out. Knocking things over, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate Helen.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT MORNING. ANNIE'S HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: The cat jumps on the bed and meows. Annie opens her eyes to see Dave sleeping. She notices his college tattoo on his arm (tasmanian devil with a lacrosse stick?).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry I fell asleep while we were making out. I guess I was pretty tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its ok. Sorry I gave you a hickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. There's a knock at the door. Annie opens it to reveal NICOLE, (20), pretty and sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Dave here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole!? Hey, Nic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a surprise.
Brian 1, Brian 2 and Mark appear in the doorway as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I'm sorry. She made us bring her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you have her fake I.D..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and I couldn't go anywhere last night. I tried calling you fifty fucking times. And YOU? You were what, hooking up with this fossil?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up or I will kick your ass bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, that is not nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are you forty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm in my low thirties...(under her breath) and you could never kick my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timid) You heard me. Annie immediately gets punched in the face. Annie is shocked and swings back, hitting Nicole in the face. She's proud of herself. Nicole's two friends enter and jump on Annie. HUGE GIRL FIGHT. EXT. HOTEL RICK. FIVE MINUTES LATER. Annie is outside of the hotel. Guys are pulling the girls off of Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baker Community College bitch!

The girls leave in victory. Dave turns and mouths to Annie âI'm sorry.â INT. ANNIE'S HOTEL BATHROOM. She frantically tries to cover up her HUGE hickey and evidence of the fight, with make-up. She remembers a small cowboy print tablecloth from the other room and wraps it around her neck like a scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls are hung over and eating. Annie arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. What are you, going to a rodeo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, you missed it. I scammed all night last night. I met this guy named Darwin. He works for Cingular. He had a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why are you wearing all that makeup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's covering up bruises, cuts and a hickey. I got into fight with a community college student and her friends because I spent the night with her boyfriend after spending the entire night trying to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to find YOU. I tried to call you all night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I-(to Lil} Can I talk to you for a minute? Annie takes Lillian away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on? You told Helen you were sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sick. Helen told you that because... I couldn't afford to go with you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say something?--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Lillian, we're going to be late for our honey facials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, can you just give us a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, we're gonna be late. I don't wanna be rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny. You know what? As the Maid of honor, which is what I am and what you are not, I am asking you to just give us a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, excuse me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to take it easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, if it makes you feel any better (getting emotional] I got slapped last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this huge girl. She was a working in the bathroom. I just... I didn't cut in line. I didn't! She chased me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becca it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, she looked like Popeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives here! She lives in Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to run into her. Just shut-up about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys stop! Please! Annie, I'm so sorry about last night. I feel horrible. I want to hear everything that happened. Tonight, you're not leaving my side. We're hittin' the strip club all of us and we're going to put this shit behind us. Okay?! The girls agree. Dana rubs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh your arm does not still hurt. INT. FANCY CASINO SHOPPING MALL. LATER. Bridesmaids window shop. Something in a fancy boutique catches Annie's eye, she smiles. Ransom jeans.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STRIP CLUB. THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: The ladies sit at the front row tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you ladies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all , we're gonna need some ones over here. Here's a hundred. Keep twenty for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, Ann! A siren goes off. V.O. Good evening ladies, and welcome to Thunderbird. Our first male entertainer has been roaming the prairie for many, many lonely nights... A horse winnies. Ladies scream.

dialogues.speaker: V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here he is...looking for a sweet lady to keep him company under the stars...say hello to Cowboy Ron! A male stripper comes out on a cardboard horse, humping

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking for someone. The room goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There he is ladies looking for that special woman, looking for his briiide...And I believe the person he's looking for is Lillian Donovan! The girls scream. Lillian mouths to Annie âI'm gonna ki you.â Cowboy Ron takes her up on stage. He puts her in chair and humps her face. Everyone is cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie, your missing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me. Nobody talk to me. Leslie has her hands on the bare ass of a stripper who is dancing in her face. Stripper #2 appears. V.O. Wow, looks like Cowboy Ron has a friend on the prairie and he's lookin' for a lady too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Annie) Get her! Get her!!

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Stripper #2 pulls Annie up to the stage, lays her on the ground and simulates sex with her. Standing above her, pulls his chaps off. We see that his balls are not all the way tucked into his g-string. The girls cringe. As he stands above her, in slow motion, we see a bead of sweat leave his balls and fly into Anni's open laughing mouth. She dry heaves. The stripper is oblivious, goes to another girl. Lillian and Annie roll around on the ground laughing. EXT. STRIP CLUB. Everyone's laughing as they exit the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was disgusting! I'm so glad I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a picture of the balls. I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts her arm around Annie). You lucky bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only you Annie. Hands down, best moment of the weekend. Annie finally feels a part of the group. INT. AIRPLANE. DAY. Annie walks to first class, everyon's sleeping. She hears Lillian laughing really hard, pointing at pictures in a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look, there's your boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, he's like 65. Ok, look Lillian that's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. You know who that actually looks like? Remember when we went to Miami and we had to rent towels--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, at that beach, that weird beach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that lady came up to us wearing that mesh top!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was crazy. Annie sinks. A flight attendant appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you can't be up here. You have to go back to coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just stretching my legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. Annie stares at her. The flight attendant holds out her hand for Annie to grab.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on...it's ok, c'mon. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, that's going to be seventy -five dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five dollars a day. Three days. Seventy -five dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hmm mm. That's for this lot, you parked in this lot. The lots are exactly the same, separated by a white line. Annie empties her wallet, her poker winnings are gone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Annie is driving. She sees Rhodes, and stops. EXT. HIGHWAY. LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know what's going on. You're jealous of that Helen girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? No, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you I am not jealous of Helen, okay? She's tall and thin and rich and pretty. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, you know you got it goin' on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I got it goin' on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Thanks a lot. They nudge each other. He accidentally nudges her off the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! Now Annie is back in her running car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good rest of your shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm heading home. Got my sister staying with me for a few days. Sh's been thinking of divorcing of her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had an affair and they've got kids so it's complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister is a hell of a woman, you know? And her husband is- you know what I think cheating is? It's weak. It's a weak person that cheats. Something clicks with Annie, she sees him in a new light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Um, I feel the same way. Um, anyway um, maybe I'll drive by you next week. I have to make this drive again...so... She tries to flirt a little, pulls her hair back. He sees her hickey!!!! She starts itching her arm, still flirting and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh, great, I think I was allergic to the soap at the hotel. Ahhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I should go..now. Don't forget to call my friend about those tail lights. They're really starting to bug me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Ok, well, have a good weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. He abruptly walks back to his car. She drives away confused. INT. ANNIE'S APT. LATER THAT EVENING. Annie arrives home to another âmomâ package. She pull out some cheap cosmetics. She pulls out a bottle of White Diamonds perfume by Elizabeth Taylor, low calorie mints, some pepper spray, a book titled â100 Survival tips For the Independent Woman.â A check for $25. She opens the book, sees chapters entitled âYou Don't Have to Work for AAA to Change a Tire.â â How to Jack CarJacker.â âAnyone with Arms Can Skin a Deerâ etc. tries to read but the itching is driving her crazy.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DOCTOR'S OFFICE. NEXT DAY
dialogues.text: Annie's on the table while the DOCTOR examines her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've got good news for you. You're going to live. Hahahah. It's not an allergic reaction though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got body lice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you recently come in contact with or slept anywhere that you think you might

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to wash every fabric in your apartment and I'll give you a topical cream that should knock it out pretty quick. I've got some samples.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Annie sits on the doorstep. Lillian runs up with a bunch of stuff in her arms and opens the door. They enter the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I was at our travel agen's trying to figure out how to get my da's family out here, they all have to fly at different times, uggh. What's that on your arms? She sees some of Annie's lice medicine motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh...I did a face mask. I must have gotten some on me and didn't rinse it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I'm sorry, I have to check one thing really quick. When is my hair consultation? Lillian frantically looks through her calender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I want to talk to you about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. (starts to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. I'm going to have my period on my wedding day...and my honeymoon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok. I mean it's not like it's your first time doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our wedding night though!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can still have sex, just put a towel down in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this. This sucks. (beat) Oh, Annie I wanted to ask you. Do you think for the cocktail party before the reception we should have a string trio or a horn trio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just realize what you just asked me right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said a string trio or horn trio. I thought you didn't want anything fancy, you know, just âkeep it simple.â âNot a big deal.â

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but now that I'm planning everything it's just...I wanna do it right. It's once in a life time. It's my wedding. Lillian's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh! It's Dougie's Mom. She's mad at me because I won't let her invite everyone from her work. Oh! That reminds me. If you're not going to bring anybody, will you let me know? I gotta free up some spots. (into phone] Hello? Lillian walks away with the phone. Annie is speechless. INT. ANNIE'S LAUNDRY ROOM. Dryer is going. Annie is sorting a huge pile of sheets, towels, etc. Her cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie? Where are you? Inside a truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm doing laundry, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, the shower needs to happen soon. We haven't heard from you and everyone is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. I'm trying to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie can I dialog openly with you? I know you're having some financial trouble and I think it would be best if I did the shower. Now before you say anything, let me say that showers can be very expensive and I think what's important here is what's best for Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to give me an answer now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have it. You should have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Well, I'll definitely need some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you bring the cookies? Annie hangs up, looks at her laundry piles. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HARRINGTONS. LATER
dialogues.text: Annie behind her counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me!! A snotty thirteen year old, valley-type, rich girl stands at Annie's counter with an iced coffee chewing gum.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a birthday gift for my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your best friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sip] What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's gonna happen when you get older? Did you ever think of that? What about when she makes new friends and they're more successful than you are? Girl stares annoyingly, chewing and sipping.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Huh? And they buy her facials and designer dresses for cheap and yo're stuck selling jewelry to teenagers wh's outfit cost more than your rent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm....you're weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be a slut in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an old, single loser who has no friends, works in a jewelry store, colors her own hair, and will never know the feeling of owning a luxury car.
She sips in victory, slurps up the last drop noisily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly] You. Little. Cunt. The girls eyes widen. The camera pans to show that the girl's dad and Donna have been there the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donna stands across from Annie wh's cleaning out her locker. She sadly starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I knew a girl once. Karen Stippleton. She was really something. The life of the party, a concert pianist, she had naturally curly hair, and skin black as night. But one evening at a dinner party I walked in on her in the bathroom putting a vile of cocaine up her buttocks and last I heard, she was playing the saxophone outside of a drug store. And I'm gonna say something to you I should have told her. Don't waste your life. Find out what your gifts are and use them. Donna hugs Annie, then leaves her in the break room. INT. ANNIE'S APARTMENT. LATER THAT DAY. Annie arrives completely depressed. Outside her doorstep is yet another package. Annie takes it inside. INT. ANNIE'S APT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, another package from your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. It is a beautiful pink and white striped box with her name and address in calligraphy. When Annie opens the lid, âCanon in Dâ plays and a real butterfly flies ou

She reads, âA Shower for Lillian.â Steve comes over t see. On one side of the box, there is a beautiful sculpture of Lillian and Dougie as Bride and Groom, a candle with Lillian's face printed on it and some chocolates. Annie takes the invitation out, opens it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? The invitation reads:

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Please join us for a Parisian Brunch at the home of Helen Harris III to celebrate the marriage of Lillian Donovan and Douglas Price. Let us âshowerâ Lillian with gifts and love. Date: Sunday the 20th. Time: 2:00 post meridian. Address and phone number below. Responde S'il Vous Plait. Yay! Annie picks up the phone, calls the R.S.V.P. number. Canon in D. plays. and a recorded message begins.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello. This is Helen. You have reached the Responde S'il Vous Plait line for Lillian's shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Please listen to all of the following menu options before making your selection. If you would like to reply âouiâ, press one. To reply ânoâ, press two. For where the bride and groom are registered, press three. If you require a vegetarian meal. Press 4. If you are vegan, press 5. A dairy free meal, press 6. Kosher meals will not be available. For the Lillian and Dougie story, narrated by me, please press 7. To hear a twenty-four hour wedding music mix, press 8, put your phone on speaker, light the Atmospheria candle you've just received and think about the eternal union that is marriage. I'm Helen Harris IV, and this is me saying au revoir! But before I do, here's a message from SUSAN SARANDON!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN SARANDON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello, I'm Susan Sarandon, the movie star. I just wanted to say congratulations to Lillian and Dougie. Even though I don't believe in marriage, I do âbelieve in the church of basebalâ. Just kidding. That's a line from my movie Bull Durham. I- Annie hangs up quickly. INT. ANNIE'S APARTMENT. DAYTIME. Annie's relaxation CD is playing as she lies talking on the phone to her Mom, who is painting a very life-like picture of Enrique Iglesias in concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there an animal over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a C.D. She rolls over and turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm flying straight to O'Hare the day of the shower cause I wanna get my hair done. Did you see that invitation? I didn't get the significance of the dead butterfly, but it looks like w're gonna have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already know what it's gonna be like. It's gonna be uncomfortable and weird...I don't wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, listen to yourself. You ca't let her new friends get in the way of your being a part of one of the best days of Lil's life. NO way. You have a history with her that no one else has. So you walk into that party knowing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie drives to Helen's. She sees a pink and white highway sign (that looks like a traditional highway exit sign) âLillian's Shower Rue. This exitâ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. She turns into the gates of âWhitewater Estates.â The is, a life-size sculpture of a bride and groom. As she gets closer, she sees they are real life models. They smile at Annie, wink at her and wave her by. At the next stop sign, a butler appears with a tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a guest of Helen Harris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower is one mile away. He hands her a pink lemonade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a cup-holder. As she's driving, little pink things start to fly beside her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One flies in her car. They're Rose petals! Annie's shitty car drives down a road covered with Rose petals. At the driveway, she is greeted by a valet in a pink bow-tie and beret. As she reaches for her gift from the passenger seat, another valet opens that door and take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be placed in the gift room for you madame. He reaches for the cookies she made, and she stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take those.
Annie watches the valet drives her car away. When she turns back around, there is a man with a white horse holding out his hand to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like an assisted ride to the main house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to? An annoyed Annie arrives at the house on the horse with the man leading her on foot, holding the cookies. She dismounts. The front door is swung open by two attendants. As she enters the mansion, groups of girls pass by her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most amazing shower 've ever been to/Can you believe this?/What a lucky bride/What a good friend... Helen's house is ALL cream and white with gold. Couches are puffy, etc. Annie walks to the backyard. We hear French standards. Beautiful tables are set. Swans and bunnies milling about. Attendants ready to serve. In the middle of everything stands an eight foot tall round âsignâ that says âLillian and Dougieâ in puffy pi cursive. A waiter offers Annie champagne. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: BECCA AND LESLIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Annie! They walk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe this shit? Annie is still staring at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big cookie huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? They point to the âsignâ. Annie walks closer to see i indeed a huge cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. Sugar cookie.
Leslie takes a piece off, eats it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's even better if you dip it in the chocolate. REVEAL a glorious four tiered chocolate fountain. Girls are around it dipping strawberries and pieces of the big cookie, laughing. Helen is there taking their praise. Annie is pissed and plops her tupperware of cookies on a nearby table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annieee!!! Lillian runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: LILLIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Can you believe this?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Lillian!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming Mom! I gotta go say hi to my aunts. She leaves and Helen appears out of nowhere again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's nothing....so...Just make yourself at home. Enjoy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (under her breath) Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I love this shower, and i's amazing. I said all that. Annie leaves. Two hip hop dancers wearing pink berets approach Helen and jam out in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, not me, NOT ME! The GUESTS. Hip hop dance with the GUESTS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking.

dialogues.speaker: INT-HELENS POWDER ROOM
dialogues.text: Annie puts lotion her hands. She sees a magazine photo of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: face super imposed over them. On the counter is a framed photo of Helen, soft lit, posed with her hand gently

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: face. She also sees a photo of Helen and Lillian from Vegas on the plane. Happy. As Annie leaves, she runs into her Mom, wh's new hairstyle is a bit overdone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. Hi! They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sweetheart. (to herself) I wish Barb could see me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Well I'm happy to see you! I'll see you out there. I need to wash the horse off my hands. Mom goes into the bathroom. Megan approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, did you see the party favors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they're perfect and amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dogs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And they're wrapped up like presents. They said we have to wait until we leave but I cant stop thinking about them. I gotta go tell Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: EXT- HELEN'S BACK YARD- MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Annie now stands next to the chocolate fountain. She looks around, drops her glass in it and unplugs it with her foot. It stops flowing. She looks around and throws some leaves in it and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: attention by microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello ladies. Bonjour. (french sentence)Yay! Welcome. I am your host Helen, a bridesmaid in Lillian's wedding. I want you all to have a wonderful time. Eat, drink, please have some cookie! She laughs and then becomes very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian. Today's your day. I'd like to make a beautiful toast, âYou are pretty, fun, sweet, look at all of your friends. Girlpower!â Everyone enjoy your lunch, served along with the musical stylings of...The LILLIANETTE'S!!! A quartet, all in pink and white and harmonize. âLillia Lillian, Lillian, Lillian! When Lillian was a little girl...â Judy claps and enjoys the music. She leans over to Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on honey. The shower is a hit.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HELEN'S GREAT ROOM. LATER.
dialogues.text: Everyone sits surrounded by decorations, pictures of Dougie and Lillian as babies, flowers, fire in the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone it's game time! Please take your piece of paper, put it on top of your head, and with your other hand try to draw what Lillian and Dougie's first baby is going to look like!!! Ready? GO! Everyone draws, giggles, looks at their stupid drawings, laughing. Annie cheats and draws it on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: DANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the winner is...Annie? Dana holds up a perfectly realistic drawing of a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's mine. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls spin a blind-folded 86 year old ELLIE around 3 times, Then they swing her holding her hands and feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two...three! Annie looks confused. They throw Ellie onto a huge pile of pillows. This is a terrible game.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER GIRLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Find the veil! C'mon Ellie! Come on Look! You can do it! It's right there! Ellie feels around in the huge pile of pillows. She finds the veil, holds it up in victory and then falls down from dizziness.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER GIRLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: YAAAAY! YOU DID IT! WoooHoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: #9. What is Lillian's favorite ice cream flavor? Write it down...quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath, to the woman next to her) Ew. Kinda smells funny in here. Doesn't it? Smells bad. This house has a weird smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, last one. For the big prize. #10. What is the craziest place Lillian and Dougie....? Helen strongly hints with a weird smile instead of saying, â...had sex?â Shower Girls Ooooh and Ahhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Wow, looks like someone's a pervert. It's none of my business. She's gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very emotional) I'm putting a blue bead on this âadvice necklaceâ to represent the ocean. It may not always be smooth sailing but you can ride the waves together. Dana cries and takes a picture. Everyone applauds,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to person near her) The ocean's are really polluted right now. Its not something to joke about.

dialogues.speaker: INT-HELEN'S GREAT ROOM
dialogues.text: Lillian opens presents in front of huge photograph of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! My towels! Thank you Dana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to get you something you could use everyday and something pretty. Dana takes a picture, Lillian grabs another box, giddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie. (opens it) Oh, our mugs! Thank you Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you registered for 'em so thank yourself, you picked them out. I did't do anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's from me. Helen hands Lillian her gift. Lil opens it and holds up beautiful lingerie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo/Ahhhhh etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, brothel gear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto] It's disgusting. Here Mom's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what's this? Lillian pulls out an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Wow, cash. Kinda tacky. Lillian opens the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Helen. Lillian holds up the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey what are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two first class tickets to Sea World. How did you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! What is going on with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing have fun at Sea World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go in the other room and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up you ridiculous person, you a sneaky little cream and white cashmere--.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie. Everyone I am so sorry, I really don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do.(laughs) Horses? Sculptures? Posters? Look at this stupid house! This stupid marshmallow puffy furniture! (pointing outside) And look at that cookie! Would you please everyone! Speaking of that cookie. I never got a piece! Annie marches into the back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting, we see her through the large

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you honestly think 30 women were gonna finish this?! You know what!? 'll help you out! She tries to take down the cookie and struggles with it. We watch her from the house. Fall over with the cookie, she runs over to the chocolate fountain and tries to tip it over, it's obviously too heavy. She tries to empty it with her hands onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm. Nothing says friendship like a thousand gallons of hot unsanitary chocolate! Hello swan, are you having fun? Did you enjoy the hip-hop dancers?

Everyone is watching Annie. She is fighting and punching the air like a crazy person, chasing a swan. A little girl starts crying. Annie walks back through the house, through the crowd holding her chocolate covered hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually thought I wanted to be like you...and you and YOU, to be a part of this world. That's not who I am. I make bad choices. I'm broke, I lost my stupid job, I'm thirty two years old and I still answer booty calls. I don't like Mike Donahue cause he () on our date. I have a single black hair that grows out of my chin and I can't wear white t-shirts cause something about my sweat turns the pits yellow! AND you know when we were in Vegas? When you were all staying at your luxury hotel? I was staying at Hotel RICK where got BODY LICE! So Helen, you can have the coveted Maid of Honor title. You can have it all wrapped up in a big pink obnoxious musical box! Because all its brought me is a big pain in my ass. Congratulations! Annie leaves and Lillian runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie stop! I don't know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let me fill you in. Ever since you got engaged, my life has turned to shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry the the happiest time in my life has brought you so much misery. Do you know how selfish that sounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm selfish? You're the one that's been so wrapped up in all this. Designer dressed, extravagant hotels, this shower, this is not you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my wedding and you've made it all about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well at least my friendship's not for sale. This hangs in the air. Annie storms off. Lillian storms back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think she still has body lice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else?! Anyone else have something they wanna say to me?! Dana can't contain herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my chin done! Becca stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin smokes pot! Leslie stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant! Megan stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took two dogs already. There in the back of my van! INT. ANNIE'S CAR. MOMENTS LATER- HIGHWAY. Annie is pissed. She sees a squirrel in the road (close up of squirrels big eyes). She tries to avoid it, slams on her breaks and BOOM! Annie is rear-ended! The driver behind her backs up, peels out and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Her car won't start. Trying to keep it together, she grabs her running shoes from the back seat and storms down the highway, trying not to cry. A cop car pulls next to her. I's Rhodes.
Rhodes is looking under her hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't say I'm surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Taillights. I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've taken it to my friend-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I KNOW! Yes, you're friend! But I didn't ok?! I didn't get them fixed! I don't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Don't take it out on me. This is your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE hit ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no taillights! You did't get them fixed! You don't get to blame anyoe else. It's your fault. Annie starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: RHODES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where you going?! Annie keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're going to walk fifteen miles?! Another WISE decision!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that you not taking responsibility is why we're standing out here! YOU did not make an effort to fix that problem. This hits Annie. Rhodes is physically worked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you yelling at me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dangerous! You're putting your life, and others in danger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm! Sorry! He calms down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all I know, is that you're kinda crazy. You're always stressed out or late, complaining about something, and now you're yelling at me! And for some reason, all I've ever wanted to do is ask you on a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well save yourself the trouble, and don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm not much of a hickey guy anyway. Annie remembers her hickey. He saw it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have said ânoâ anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then you have yourself a good night ma'am. Annie regrets that. He drives away leaving her there. She is alone. EXT. BILL COZBI'S AUTO ELECTRIC. Annie's car gets towed into the shop.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: BILL enters with a clip board. He is a stocky Milwaukee good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodes told me a while back you might be stopping in. I'm Bill Cozbi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was beginning to think we'd never see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. I'm irresponsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, no one likes taking care of that stuff. But you are going to have to leave your car here for a week or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week? INT. STEVE'S CAR. CONTINUOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you kind of had a bad time at the wedding shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did. Everything's just... She starts crying. Steve hands her a tissue from the middle console.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just--this has been a really shitty day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ok, don't get mad at me, but it seems like you have a lot of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do! Right? Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you considered the idea that maybe, possibly, perhaps, it's you that makes them shitty? Annie stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, maybe it's your attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not about attitude. It's just the facts! My life hasn't turned it out the way I expected. I don't have any of those things that gives a person points in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that might be your problem. I think you read too many of those magazines. You don't need things to be someone. Tyra said that. Tyra Banks. INT. ANNIE AND STEVE'S APT. Annie sits on the couch with Steve in a daze, watching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian. She doesn't even know what to say, so she doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie reads a shitty magazine at the counter. She turns to see the gray-haired, outdoorsy WOMAN that she and Lillian pointed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone sitting here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The lady sits next to Annie and smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie looks in the classifieds. A lot say âcollege degree required.â She looks up and sees TED has walked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Ted. You're in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Listen I'm going out tonight but I should be home around 11, you wanna come over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Ok, sure. Ted smiles at her. Annie stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait no. No. No. I don't think I do. Because answering your booty calls and having you kick me out after a night of no-strings-attached sex doesn't feel good. NO girls feel good after that and if they say they do they're LYING. But it's not your fault. Its me. It's me. Have a great life. And you can keep the plant. Annie grabs her stuff and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ANNIE'S BEDROOM THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: She lies on her bed staring at the ceiling. She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lillian's phone lights up, it's on silent. She is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: names cut out and being placed at different tables. Her mom, Laurie, Helen, and two women argue about the seating chart. Lillian looks distraught.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ANNIE'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Annie sadly hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: INT. QUAINT BAKERY. DAY
dialogues.text: TIM, the owner is sitting with Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't think of anything else to tell you. Did you have any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think we've covered everything. I'm really excited and thank you. Annie gathers her things.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll see you next Monday. What time do I start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four a.m. Annie is a little surprised. Ti's smiling.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll get used to it. Annie smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and I wanna try one of those moonpies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling] Yeah. Ok. INT. COLLEGE CAMPUS. Annie weaves through the crowded hallway, approaches a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm here to inquire about financial aid. Her cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take these to the second window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? Annie's trying to find her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. It's too late, she looks at her phone. It was Lillian. No message. She doesn't call her back.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BILL COZBI'S. EVENING
dialogues.text: Annie gets out of Steve's car. INT. BILL COZBI'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parts and labor, we're lookin' at eight hundred dollars. But with your discount...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discount?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Rhodes and I worked out a deal way back when, so, this one's on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. I owe him big time. He runs background checks on all the guys my daughter dates. There's been a lot of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding! If you see him, would you thank him for me and tell him that I'm crazy and I'm sorry. He'll know what you mean. EXT. HIGHWAY. Annie drives past Rhodes' at his post, flicking her brand new taillights. He sees her, but does't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pull her over. She drives by him again and swerves all over the road. He really wants to pull her over, but he doesn't. She goes back one more time, throws a bunch of trash and diet coke cans out of the window. He still ignores her. She gives up and goes home. 't get to this point until this morning. wanted to see if we're going in the right direction with annie uniting bridesmaids and saving the day. INT. ANNIE'S APT. NIGHTTIME.
